title: The Online Safety Act Doesn't Protect Children, It Undermines Digital Privacy
description: The internet today isn’t the same place it was many years ago. It’s faster, more connected, and more dangerous, especially for young users. Cyberbullying, explicit content, targeted ads, and data harvesting are just some of the many threats teens can face online. In response to these growing issues, the British Parliament passed the Online Safety Act in 2023.

title: Smile, You’re Being Watched: The Dangers of AI Surveillance in Schools
description: From finance and healthcare to media and marketing, AI is transforming entire sectors, both positively and negatively. In schools, the issues surrounding artificial intelligence have mostly centered on students, especially fears of students using AI to write essays or cheat on tests. But now, schools themselves are increasingly the ones using AI, not just regulating it
